_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The Buckeye Terminals, LLC - Jacksonville Rail Butane System was constructed in accordance with the National Fire Protection Association Code #58 for Liquefied Petroleum Gas Storage, and it is the Facility's policy to follow the most current future editions to the extent feasible and adhere to all applicable Federal, State, and Local codes/laws.  If an emergency were to occur, it is the Facility's policy to contact the Jacksonville Fire and Rescue Department and Duval County Emergency Management, as appropriate, through the 911 Service.  The Facility currently maintains a trained Incipient Stage Fire Response and First Responder-Operations Level Hazardous Materials Response Team to respond to the initial stages of an emergency.



The Buckeye Terminals, LLC - Jacksonville Rail Butane System stores butane in an aboveground storage vessel and offloads railcars at two rail offloading towers and loads and offloads transports at one shared offload/loading station.



The Worst-Case and Alternate Case release scenarios were evaluated and communicated to the

Jacksonville Fire and Rescue Department.  Additionally, the facility maintains an Emergency Response Plan to provide procedures in dealing with product releases.



The Buckeye Terminals, LLC - Jacksonville Rail Butane System complies with the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency's Accident Prevention Rules (40 CFR Part 68 Subpart D- Program Level 3).  Additionally, this plan meets the requirements of the U.S. Department of Labor -

Occupational Safety and Health Administration's Process Safety Management regulations (inclusive

of all 14 elements) for Highly Hazardous Chemicals (29 CFR Part 1910.119).



This Facility has never had an accident or incident involving the Butane System resulting in deaths, injuries, property/environmental damage, evacuations, or sheltering-in-place.



In the event of an emergency involving the Jacksonville Rail Butane System, it is the policy of the Facility to initially contact the Ja

cksonville Fire and Rescue Department and request their assistance.  The Facility's Emergency Response Plan is coordinated with the Jacksonville Fire and Rescue Department and the Duval County Emergency Management.  The Jacksonville Fire and Rescue Department is aware of the Facility, its safety systems, access points, and protective procedures in the event of a significant release.  The Terminal is fully secured with fencing and controlled access in accordance with its site Security Plan.



Buckeye continually evaluates the process for opportunities to improve safety through additional training and drilling and will attempt to include first responders in sessions as applicable.
